title: [Caffe2] Use protobuf's option to disable binary when cross compilation
body_html:
As Yangqing said here, cmake -P cmake_install.cmake doesn't work correctly when compiling for Android, because it tries to install protobuf binary files, but these files are not generated in cross compilation. Since Yangqing's commit for protobuf has already been merged, we might want to update our code to enable cmake install for Android compilations.

There are only a few commits updated in submodule protobuf, so I think it will not break anything.
body_text:
As Yangqing said here, cmake -P cmake_install.cmake doesn't work correctly when compiling for Android, because it tries to install protobuf binary files, but these files are not generated in cross compilation. Since Yangqing's commit for protobuf has already been merged, we might want to update our code to enable cmake install for Android compilations.
There are only a few commits updated in submodule protobuf, so I think it will not break anything.
body:
As [Yangqing said here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/cmake/ProtoBuf.cmake#L75), `cmake -P cmake_install.cmake` doesn't work correctly when compiling for Android, because it tries to install protobuf binary files, but these files are not generated in cross compilation. Since [Yangqing's commit for protobuf](https://github.com/google/protobuf/pull/3878) has already been merged, we might want to update our code to enable cmake install for Android compilations.

There are only a few commits updated in submodule protobuf, so I think it will not break anything.
